{{convert|3540|mm|in|1|abbr=on}} + {{convert|1200|mm|in|1|abbr=on}} | length = {{convert|7420|mm|in|1|abbr=on}} | width = {{convert|2550|mm|in|1|abbr=on}} | height = {{convert|3065|mm|in|1|abbr=on}} | weight = {{convert|7000|kg|lb|abbr=on}} empty
{{convert|15500|kg|lb|abbr=on}} loaded | related = | designer = | sp = }} {{Infobox Automobile engine | image = | name = Renault DXi7 | aka = | manufacturer = [[Renault Trucks|Renault]] | type = [[Straight engine|straight six]] | production = | predecessor = | successor = | bore = {{convert|108|mm|in|1|abbr=on}} | stroke = {{convert|130|mm|in|1|abbr=on}} | displacement = 7,145 cc | length = | diameter = | width = | height = | weight = {{convert|645|kg|lb|0|abbr=on}} | block = | head = | valvetrain = | supercharger = | turbocharger = | fuelsystem = | fueltype = [[Diesel fuel]] | oilsystem = | coolingsystem = [[Water cooled]] | power = {{convert|177|kW|hp|0|abbr=on}} @ 2000 rpm | specpower = | torque = {{convert|920|Nm|ftlbf|abbr=on}} @ 1300 rpm | compression = 18:1 | fuelcon = {{convert|28.5|L/100 km|abbr=on}} | specfuelcon = | oilcon = }} '''Tatra T 810''' is a medium truck made by Czech company [[Tatra (company)|Tatra]]. Unlike other Tatra trucks, it doesn't use the traditional [[Tatra (company)#Tatra concept|Tatra conception]] of [[backbone chassis]] and swinging half-axles, but the customary truck architecture with [[Ladder_frame#Ladder_Frame|conventional frame]]. ==History==
[[File:Brno, Autotec 2010, Tatra, hasiÄi T 815-7.JPG|100px|center]]
'''Current Tatra production''' *'''[[Tatra 158 Phoenix|Tatra 158 Phoenix]] *'''[[Tatra 163|Tatra 163 Jamal]]''' *'''Tatra 810''' *'''[[Tatra 815|Tatra 815]]''' *'''[[Tatra 816]]''' *'''[[Tatra 817]]'''
In early 1990s the [[Czech Army]] was aiming to replace its aging fleet of medium trucks, which was represented by the [[Praga (company)|Praga]] [[V3S]] model introduced into production as early as in 1953. The selection procedure was won the ''RoudnickÃ© slÃ©vÃ¡rny a strojÃ­rny'' (''Foundries And Machine-Works of Roudnice'') with its [[ROSS R210]] project. The R210 was outsourcing many components from [[Renault Trucks|Renault]]. Since 1996 the company delivered 15 vehicles for the testing purposes, after which the delivery of serial vehicles was supposed to start, however in 1998 the Czech Army canceled the contract. The company has invested a lot into the development of the truck and subsequently it bankrupted.{{cs icon}} {{cite web |first=Rostislav|last=JanÄar |url=http://technet.idnes.cz/podivejte-se-na-vyrobu-a-testovani-vojenske-tatry-810-nastupce-vejtrasky-1o2-/tec_reportaze.asp?c=A081022_120822_tec_reportaze_rja |title=PodÃ­vejte se na vÃ½robu a testovÃ¡nÃ­ vojenskÃ© Tatry 810, nÃ¡stupce âvejtÅaskyâ |date=5 February 2009 |accessdate=1 September 2010 |work=idnes.cz }}{{cs icon}} {{cite web |first=Martin|last=Å imÃ­Äek |url=http://forum.valka.cz/viewtopic.php/t/41679 |title=ROSS R210.12 VV 6x6 |date= |accessdate=1 September 2010 |work=valka.cz }} In 2002 the Tatra company bought the documentation and rights to the R210 truck in order to enter the market of medium trucks (from 3,5 tons to 12 tons), as all the models the company offered were in the class of heavy trucks. It intended to modernize the original project, and it also hoped that the Czech Army will finally undertake the replacement of its fleet of 4000 Praga V3s (while Tatra was supplying the Army with heavy trucks since World War I). Tatra closed alliance with other companies to work on the project together; for example the Praga was supposed to deliver gear boxes and [[portal axle]]. Other components were to be delivered by Renault (engine, cab).{{cs icon}} {{cite web |first=|last= |url=http://www.tatra.cz/web_cz/zajimavosti/nakvoz/Tatra_N2_cz%20.htm |title=ÄeskÃ½ prÅ¯mysl se pÅipravuje na reformu ozbrojenÃ½ch sil |date= |accessdate=1 September 2010 |work=tatra.cz }} In 2005 the Czech government approved acquisition of the T810 trucks in August 2005, while deliveries were scheduled to start in April 2008.{{cite web |first=|last= |url=http://www.army.cz/scripts/detail.php?id=6623 |title=Medium Off-road Truck |date= |accessdate=1 September 2010 |work=army.cz }} The civilian version of T810 was introduced in 2010, with Tatra claiming it is the only truck with maximum weight of 15,5 tons that has three driven axles, which together with its [[portal axle|portal architecture]] is supposed to give it advantage over the competition in terrain.{{cs icon}} {{cite web |first=|last= |url=http://www.ct24.cz/doprava/98941-tatra-predstavila-civilni-verzi-t810/ |title=Tatra pÅedstavila civilnÃ­ verzi T810 |date=19 August 2010 |accessdate=1 September 2010 |work=ct24.cz }} {{Commons category|Tatra 810}} ==References== {{reflist}} {{Tatra models}} [[Category:Tatra vehicles|T810]] [[Category:Cars of the Czech Republic]] [[Category:Trucks]] [[Category:Military trucks]] [[Category:All-wheel-drive vehicles]] [[Category:Off-roading]] [[cs:Tatra 810]] [[fa:ØªØ§ØªØ±Ø§ ØªÛ Û¸Û±Û°]] [[sk:Tatra 810]] [[fi:Tatra T810]]
